title: Requires landlords to hold public forums with tenants before permitting cell phone towers to be placed on residential buildings; requires school to notify parents an
summary: Requires landlords to hold a public forum with tenants prior to contracting with cell phone carriers to mount cell phone towers on residential buildings; requires school districts to provide parents and school faculty with written notification of cell phone towers being mounted onto school facilities.

       Introduced  by  M. of A. COLTON, LANCMAN, PHEFFER, CASTRO, KOLB, TOBACCO
         -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. GLICK, HIKIND, MENG, MILLMAN,  SCHI-

         Committee on Housing

       AN ACT to amend the real property law, in relation  to  requiring  land-
         lords  to  hold  a public forum with tenants prior to contracting with
         cell phone service carriers to mount cell phone towers on  residential
         buildings;  and  to  amend the education law, in relation to requiring
         school districts to provide parents and school  faculty  with  written
         notification of cell phone towers being mounted onto school facilities

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The real property law is amended by adding  a  new  section
    2  238-a to read as follows:
    3    S  238-A.  DUTY  OF  LANDLORD TO HOLD A PUBLIC FORUM PRIOR TO MOUNTING
    4  CELLULAR PHONE TOWERS ONTO RESIDENTIAL  BUILDING  STRUCTURES.  1.    THE
    5  TERMS  "CELLULAR  PHONE  TOWER",  "CELLULAR  PHONE  ANTENNA"  AND  "BASE
    6  STATION" AS USED IN THIS SECTION SHALL MEAN A  STRUCTURE  CONSISTING  OF
    7  RADIOS,  COMPUTERIZED SWITCHING EQUIPMENT, AND ANTENNAS THAT RECEIVE AND
    8  TRANSMIT RADIO FREQUENCY SIGNALS WHICH FACILITATE CELLULAR PHONE  TRANS-
    9  MISSION AND RECEPTION.
   10    2. A LANDLORD SHALL BE REQUIRED TO HOLD A PUBLIC FORUM WITH HIS OR HER
   11  TENANTS  PRIOR TO CONTRACTING WITH A CELL PHONE SERVICE CARRIER TO MOUNT
   12  A CELL PHONE TOWER, CELL PHONE ANTENNA OR BASE STATION ONTO THE RESIDEN-
   13  TIAL BUILDING STRUCTURE.
   14    3. A LANDLORD WHO VIOLATES SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE
   15  SUBJECT,  IN  ADDITION  TO ANY OTHER PENALTIES THAT MAY BE PRESCRIBED BY
   16  LAW, TO A CIVIL PENALTY OF TWO HUNDRED FIFTY DOLLARS FOR EACH  DAY  THAT
   17  PASSES  AFTER  A  BUILDING  PERMIT HAS BEEN APPROVED TO BUILD A CELLULAR

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

       A. 906                              2

    1  PHONE TOWER, CELLULAR PHONE ANTENNA OR BASE STATION, TO BE MOUNTED  ONTO
    2  A RESIDENTIAL BUILDING STRUCTURE WITHOUT PROPER NOTIFICATION TO TENANTS.
    3    S  2.  The  education  law is amended by adding a new section 414-a to
    4  read as follows:
    5    S 414-A. NOTIFICATION ABOUT CELL PHONE TOWERS LOCATED ON SCHOOL FACIL-
    6  ITIES. 1. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION THE FOLLOWING  TERMS  SHALL  HAVE
    7  THE  MEANINGS SET FORTH BELOW: (A) "SCHOOL" SHALL MEAN ANY PUBLIC SCHOOL
    8  DISTRICT OR PRIVATE OR PAROCHIAL SCHOOL OR BOARD OF  COOPERATIVE  EDUCA-
    9  TIONAL SERVICES.
   10    (B)  "FACILITY"  MEANS  ANY  SCHOOL  BUILDING  USED  FOR INSTRUCTIONAL
   11  PURPOSES AND ITS SURROUNDING GROUNDS, SITES AND OTHER GROUNDS TO BE USED
   12  FOR PLAYGROUNDS, ATHLETICS AND OTHER  INSTRUCTIONAL  PURPOSES,  AND  ANY
   13  ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES.
   14    (C)  "WRITTEN  NOTIFICATION"  SHALL  MEAN  NOTICE  IN WRITING THAT IS:
   15  PROVIDED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' PARENTS OR GUARDIANS AND TO SCHOOL  STAFF
   16  MEMBERS;  OR  DELIVERED TO A RECEPTACLE DESIGNATED FOR STUDENTS' PARENTS
   17  OR GUARDIANS AND TO STAFF MEMBERS; OR MAILED  TO  STUDENTS'  PARENTS  OR
   18  GUARDIANS  AND TO STAFF MEMBERS' LAST KNOWN ADDRESS; OR DELIVERED BY ANY
   19  OTHER REASONABLE METHODS AUTHORIZED BY THE COMMISSIONER.
   20    2. SCHOOLS SHALL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO THE PARENT OR GUARDI-
   21  AN OF A STUDENT AND TO SCHOOL FACULTY, STAFF AND  ADMINISTRATORS  BEFORE
   22  CELL  PHONE  TOWERS,  CELL PHONE ANTENNAS OR BASE STATIONS ARE PLACED OR
   23  MOUNTED ONTO SCHOOL FACILITIES.
   24    3. ANY SCHOOL THAT VIOLATES SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION  SHALL  BE
   25  SUBJECT  TO  A  CIVIL  PENALTY OF FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR EACH DAY THAT
   26  PASSES AFTER A BUILDING PERMIT HAS BEEN APPROVED  TO  BUILD  A  CELLULAR
   27  PHONE  TOWER, CELLULAR PHONE ANTENNA OR BASE STATION, TO BE MOUNTED ONTO
   28  A SCHOOL FACILITY WITHOUT PROPER NOTIFICATION TO THE PARENT OR  GUARDIAN
   29  OF A STUDENT OR TO SCHOOL FACULTY, STAFF AND ADMINISTRATORS.
   30    S  3.  Severability.  If  any provision of this act or the application
   31  thereof to any person or circumstance is adjudged invalid by a court  of
   32  competent  jurisdiction,  such  judgment  shall not affect or impair any
   33  other provisions or applications of this act which can be effected with-
   34  out the invalid provision or application, and to this end the provisions
   35  of this act are severable.
   36    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
